III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
1

rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A survey was completed stating that Wedgwood Christian
Services is abusive and manipulative to Jada. No details were
provided. Jada does not have any current injuries.
Investigation Complainant/Therapist was interviewed via phone on 3/27/23.
She reported giving Youth A a survey from the referral source
after an individual therapy session with Youth A. After Youth A left,
Therapist read the survey and reported what Youth A had written
on the survey. She also reported speaking with Program Manager
later in the day and having Program Manager inform her, Youth A
reported doing very well and having no concerns. Youth A is
involved in individual therapy once a week and group therapy
once a week.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
3/27/2023. He reported being aware of the survey and instructing
Therapist to report the findings. He does not have any reports of
Youth A doing poorly in the program, and she is scheduled to be
discharged to her new placement in early May.
Program Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility,
on 3/27/2023. She reported speaking to Youth A later in the day in
which she completed the survey. She did a “wellness check” with
Youth A which involved asking her how she is doing and if she
has any issues to report. Youth A informed her she is feeling safe
and has no issues of concern. Youth A also told her other youth
were feeling safe with her on the unit. Program Manager also
reported receiving a call from Therapist and being informed of the
concerns listed on the survey. Program Manager informed
Therapist, Youth A is not reporting any concerns and shared the
conversation she had with Youth A. Program Manager reported
Youth A has informed her she knows how to be replaced from the
program by “just making allegations”.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
3/27/2023. She reported not knowing the reason for this interview
and once told she stated, “I’m not so much abused but they do
mental manipulation by playing with my mind”. She described this
“mental manipulation” as the program having consequences and
incentives to motivate youth to make changes. Youth A doesn’t
believe she should have consequences or incentives for her
behaviors, and she stated, “it’s not fair at times” because other
2

youth get extra chances. She was unable to provide a specific
example of this taking place. She reported feeling safe at the
facility.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the unit Youth A is lodged in occurred. The unit was
clean and well decorated. All required items were present.
Documents Reviewed:
Residential Updated Service Plan dated 3/22/23. This plan is
for Youth A. It is documented during this reporting period she
engaged in weekly individual and group therapy along with
occupational therapy. Her therapy sessions have been going well
and she continues to make progress. Treatment goals include
decreasing her self-harmful behavior and utilize coping skills. It is
documented she had made progress towards this goal and has
displayed no self-harming behavior during this period. The second
goal is to increase her social skills and the report documents she
is improving with this goal. The third goal is for Youth A to
increase her knowledge of previous trauma and begin the process
of healing. Youth A has also made progress on this goal.
Personal Safety plan for Youth A dated 8/30/22. This plan
outlines six actions Youth A must engage in. These involve, her
location to others when sitting, 1:1 supervision when in the
presence of a peer, report to staff when feeling personal space is
violated, minimize inappropriate sexual comments around peers,
use appropriate body movements when dancing, and see
feedback if not understanding directions from staff. It is also
documented staff are to seek opportunities to coach Youth A on
healthy social boundaries.
D.A. Blodgett St. John’s Consumer Satisfaction Survey-
Client/Child. There is no date on this document. On this form
completed by Youth A, she documents feeling safe at the facility,
staff talking to her about how she is feeling, and wanting to
discharge from the program “quicker”. She also documented
“Wedgewood is abusive and manipulative”.
Analysis Based upon the interviews there is no evidence to support Youth
A being abused or manipulated by staff or the program.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
